name: Meatloaf recipe
description: Recipe video above. Meatloaf is so much more than a giant hunk of ground beef in a loaf shape. It should ooze with flavour, be moist and tender yet not crumble apart when sliced. And the caramelised glaze is the crowning glory!
recipeIngredient: 1 kg / 2 lb   ground beef (mince) (, preferably not lean)
1/4 cup chopped parsley ((optional), or 2 tsp dried parsley or basil)
2  beef bouillon cubes (, crumbled or 2 tsp beef powder (Note 2))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Oil or spray a loaf tin. (Note 3)
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 180C/350F. Oil or spray a loaf tin. (Note 3)

recipeInstructions.text: Glaze: Mix together in a small bowl. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Glaze: Mix together in a small bowl. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Meatloaf: Place breadcrumbs in a very large bowl. Grate over onion. Mix so the breadcrumbs are all wet. (Note 4)
recipeInstructions.name: Meatloaf: Place breadcrumbs in a very large bowl. Grate over onion. Mix so the breadcrumbs are all wet. (Note 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining ingredients. Mix well using your hands. Form into a loaf shape, pinching together then smoothing over creases and cracks (helps prevent cracks during baking).
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining ingredients. Mix well using your hands. Form into a loaf shape, pinching together then smoothing over creases and cracks (helps prevent cracks during baking).

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer into loaf tin. Brush generously with glaze, using about 1/2.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer into loaf tin. Brush generously with glaze, using about 1/2.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with most of the remaining glaze. If there is excess fat pooling, scoop/pour it off.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with most of the remaining glaze. If there is excess fat pooling, scoop/pour it off.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for a further 30 minutes. Remove from oven.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for a further 30 minutes. Remove from oven.

recipeInstructions.text: Stand for 10 minutes before turning out and cutting into thick slices. You will probably get a bit of crumbling just on the edges of the first couple of slices, this is normal and indicative of the tenderness of the meatloaf (zero crumble indicates firm packed harder meatloaf which isn't as enjoyable!).
recipeInstructions.name: Stand for 10 minutes before turning out and cutting into thick slices. You will probably get a bit of crumbling just on the edges of the first couple of slices, this is normal and indicative of the tenderness of the meatloaf (zero crumble indicates firm packed harder meatloaf which isn't as enjoyable!).

recipeInstructions.text: Ideal served with a dollop of ketchup, creamy mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Ideal served with a dollop of ketchup, creamy mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables.

review.reviewBody: Made this a few times now and its a solid, go-to meatloaf for our family.

Love all your recipes.
Everything I make us always great üëç 
Thank you so much

Hi! 
Love this recipe. Can it be frozen and at what point ? After it‚Äôs formed or after it‚Äôs cooked ?
I made this last night for dinner and it was a huge success. So yummy :-) will definitely be making it again. Thanks Nagi x
I made this for tea and made 12 mini meatloaves in my silicone loaf pan. Works a treat!

The first time Ive cooked meatloaf that didn't end up looking like a dog's breakfast (my dog's not your's Nagi) Super tasty, super easy. I did sub fresh breadcrumbs fir the panko. Still worked fine :)
Wow factor in my home. My daughter detests meatloaf. Turns out I'm allowed to make this one again. My grandson told me best meatloaf he's ever had. A big thank you Nagi

I‚Äôm attempting this in a few days now that the heatwave is finally over!  Can the tomato ketchup be subbed with tomato sauce? I buy tomato sauce in bulk because hubby loves his tomato sauce on just about everything. ( typical Aussie bloke. lol )
This meatloaf recipe is SO GOOD! Served it with mushroom gravy and mashers.
Came out great. I made this, your mash potatoes recipe & coleslaw. Yummy!

I have made so many meatloaf recipes over the years, but none of them can compare to this one.  My husband requested meatloaf for his birthday dinner, so I looked to find one with consistent five star reviews and found this recipe.  I can see why it‚Äôs raved about!  It was such a hit with my family . Absolutely delicious, and the only recipe I‚Äôll be using from now on.
I covered the top with slices of bacon instead of using the glaze....delicious!  Ketchup on the side when serving.  Didn't want any added sugar.

We all love this but my 25-year old son who knows his  food, and never had meatloaf before, rates this absolutely tops. He loves the glaze especially.
I've tried it with 1.5 tsp of vegemite when I didn't have beef cubes and that worked! That makes it genuine Aussie Meatloaf :)
